form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: United States Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service, Form N-4

full_text: Form approved Budget Bureau No. 43-R 433 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE 300 No. Los Angeles Street Los Angeles, California 90012 Alien Registration No. A13 573 268 CIT 400 Petition No. King Chun Tse 1323 K Street Date DEC 14 1967 Bakersfield, California Your application has been received and arrangements have been made to help you in the next step towards naturalization. Please come to COUNTY CLERK'S OFFICE. COURT HOUSE BAKERSFIELD, CALIF. on JAN - 8 1968 at 2:00 M. The proceeding will take about two hours. If for any reason you cannot keep this appointment, return this letter immediately with your explanation and a request for a new appointment; otherwise, no further action will be taken on your application. If you are applying for citizenship for yourself, you will be tested on your knowledge of the government of the United States and its history. You will also be tested on your ability to read, write, and speak English, unless on December 24, 1952, you had been living in the United states for a total of at least 20 years and were then over 50 years old, or unless you are physically unable to read, write, or speak. BE SURE TO BRING WITH YOU THESE SIX ITEMS, AS WELL AS WHAT IS CHECKED BELOW AND ON THE REVERSE SIDE: 1. This letter 2. Alien registration receipt card(s) 3. Any draft card(s) 4. $10 in (cash) (postal money order made payable to the Clerk of Court for filing fee) 5. Any documents you have which you used in connection with any entries into the United States 6. Two witnesses who are citizens of the United States, and who seen you very as past have often for much of the 3 possible years as who have very often seen you and your child (children) who have very often seen you, your spouse, and your adopted child (children) who can identify you as the person named in your discharge certificate(s) PLEASE HAVE YOUR WITNESSES READ THIS PARAGRAPH Your witnesses, unless born in the United States, must bring with them their naturalization or citizenship certificates. If the witnesses have not known you for the entire number of years checked above, you should be prepared to give the names and addresses of two additional witnesses who know you well and have seen you very often in the places where you have lived during the remainder of those years. Arrangements will be made later to take sworn statements from these additional witnesses. (SEE OTHER SIDE) Form N-430 (Rev. 7-1-66)
